newsitem.title: FRANCE: French shares start at record high, Sanofi gains.
newsitem.headline: French shares start at record high, Sanofi gains.

text.p: French shares opened at a fresh all-time high on Wednesday, supported by a firm dollar and gains on Wall Street, traders said.
Trading was expected to remain cautious ahead of key U.S. data due today and tomorrow, they added.
The CAC-40 was up 1.08 percent at 3056.43 at 0807 GMT. It opened at 3,052.64. The previous record was established on Monday.
CAC-40 July futures were trading at 3,053 against 3,025 at Tuesdays close.
Sanofi, up 2.46 percent at 625, continued its strong rise from Tuesday on expectations it will sell its stake in the Nina Ricci perfume business.
